text: At nearly 200 metres, Smokey Hole Cave in Manchester, Jamaica is the deepest known cave in the island. ==Natural history== The cave contains a large bat roost and numerous Jamaican cave crickets (Uvaroviella cavicola). Also present are the invasive Periplaneta americana (cockroach) in small numbers, Gaucelmus cavernicola (spider), and Neoditomyia farri (fly). ==See also== *List of caves#Jamaica *Jamaican Caves Organisation *Manchester Parish, Jamaica ==References== ==External links== *Map. *Aerial view. *Photos. *Smokey Hole Cave - Field Notes. title: Smokey Hole Cave
